CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 2, 1957, pg. A8, reads: "Guiding Light - The Rev. Marvin E. Barrett, pastor of Avery Memorial AME Zion Church, North Side, hopes to rebuild the ancient church in the same spirit as its benefactor, the late Rev. Charles Avery, displayed.  The Rev. Mr. Avery, portrayed by the statue, aided fleeing slaved by hiding them in the church basement on their flight from the South to Canada and freedom. - Harris Photo."This is probably the plaster cast of the sculpture by Louis Verhaegan, the original is marble and is part of the Avery monument at Allegheny Cemetery.
TitMainTitle: Rev. Marvin E. Barrett standing next to statue of Charles Avery, Avery AME Zion Church
